variant.question: An EFIS equipped aircraft, the V1 speed reference is the

options.text: Take-off decision speed and is normally indicated on the airspeed indicator on the PFD
Take-off safety speed and is normally indicated on the VSI on the PFD
Take-off decision speed and is normally indicated on the VSI on the PFD
Take-off safety speed and is normally indicated on the airspeed indicator on the PFD

variant.question:
On an Electronic Flight Instrument System (EFIS), the following EGT parameters may be displayed 
1  instantaneous EGT
2  commanded EGT
3  maximum continuous EGT limit
4  maximum takeoff EGT limit
The combination that regroups all of the correct statements is
In an Electronic Flight Instrument System (EFIS) data relating primarily to navigation in the FMC is provided by:

options.text: Navigation radios, GPS, Inertial Reference Systems.
GPS, Aircraft Weather Radar, Navigation radios.
Inertial Reference Systems, Aircraft Weather Radar, Navigation radios.
Inertial Reference Systems, Navigation radios, Terrain Collision Alerting System.

variant.question:
Regarding Electronic Flight Instrument System (EFIS):
1) the Navigation Display (ND) displays Flight Director Bars.
2) the altimeter setting is displayed on the PFD (Primary Flight Display).
3) the PFD is the main flying instrument.
4) the FMA (Flight Mode Annunciator) is part of the ND.
The combination re-grouping all the correct statements is:
Which option lists the correct modes displayed on the Navigation Display of an EFIS equipped aircraft?

options.text: MAP or ARC (covering approximately 45° either side of the instantaneous track), ROSE (orientated to current heading up) and PLAN (flight plan map orientated to True North).
MAP or ARC (covering approximately 45° either side of the current heading), ROSE (orientated to instantaneous track up) and PLAN (flight plan map orientated to Magnetic North).
MAP or ARC (covering approximately 45° either side of the instantaneous track), ROSE (orientated to instantaneous track up) and PLAN (flight plan map orientated to True North).
MAP or ARC (covering approximately 45° either side of the instantaneous track), ROSE (orientated to current heading up) and PLAN (flight plan map orientated to Magnetic North).

variant.question: Which option lists the correct modes displayed on the Navigation Display of an EFIS equipped aircraft?

options.text: MAP or ARC (covering approximately 45° either side of the instantaneous track), ROSE (orientated to current heading up) and PLAN (flight plan map orientated to True North).
MAP or ARC (covering approximately 45° either side of the instantaneous track), ROSE (orientated to instantaneous track up) and PLAN (flight plan map orientated to True North).
MAP or ARC (covering approximately 45° either side of the current heading), ROSE (orientated to instantaneous track up)and PLAN (flight plan map orientated to Magnetic North).
MAP or ARC (covering approximately 45° either side of the instantaneous track), ROSE (orientated to current heading up) and PLAN (flight plan map orientated to Magnetic North).

variant.question: An EFIS includes the following components:

options.text: symbol generator, display unit(s), control panel.
ADC, inertial navigation computer, display unit(s).
display unit(s) only.
FMS, symbol generator, display unit(s).

variant.question: An EFIS includes the following components:

options.text: symbol generator, display unit(s), control panel, remote light sensor.
FMS, symbol generator, display unit(s).
display unit(s) only.
ADC, inertial navigation computer, display unit(s).

variant.question:
Select the option which groups all the correct statements regarding the Electronic Flight Instrument System (EFIS):
1) the Navigation Display (ND) displays Flight Director Bars.2) the altimeter setting is displayed on the PFD (Primary Flight Display).3) the PFD is the main flying instrument.4) the FMA (Flight Mode Annunciator) is part of the ND.

options.text: 2 and 3.
3 and 4.
1 and 4.
1 and 2.

variant.question: The Navigation Display (ND) of a modern EFIS-equipped jet transport aircraft can display the following information:

options.text: ARC or MAP (covering 45 degrees on either side of the instantaneous track), ROSE (with current heading up) and PLAN (map orientated to True North)
ARC or MAP (with current heading up), ROSE (covering 45 degrees on either side of the instantaneous track) and PLAN (map orientated to Magnetic North)
ARC or MAP (with current heading up), ROSE (covering 45 degrees on either side of the instantaneous track) and PLAN (map orientated to True North)
ARC or MAP (covering 45 degrees on either side of the instantaneous track), ROSE (with current heading up) and PLAN (map orientated to Magnetic North)

variant.question: On the navigation display (ND) of an EFIS equipped aircraft, the colours used are:

options.text: magenta or white for the active waypoint (TO waypoint), green for light precipitation.
amber or white for the active waypoint (TO waypoint), yellow for high precipitation.
magenta or red for the active waypoint (TO waypoint), amber for medium precipitation.
white or blue for the active waypoint (TO waypoint), red for medium precipitation.

variant.question: How does a typical EFIS system respond to the failure of a VHF navigation (VOR) receiver?

options.text: It removes the associated magenta deviation bar and/or pointer from the display.
The pointer flashes and a VOR 1 or 2 failure warning bar appears.
The deviation bar and/or pointer change colour to red and flash intermittently.
The pointer rotates around the display and a VOR 1 or 2 failure warning bar appears.

variant.question: What data are displayed on the Navigation Display (ND) of an EFIS equipped aircraft?

options.text: The flight plan, weather radar, terrain map, and intruder alerts.
The flight plan, engine failure, navigation aids, and resolution advisories.
A terrain map, navigation aids, bearings, and flight director active modes.
Intruder alerts, altitude, autopilot active modes, and weather radar.

variant.question:
Which of the following may be selected through an EFIS control panel?
  1. Altimeter pressure setting
  2. ND range
  3. TCAS mode
  4. VOR/ADF display
  5. GPWS display

options.text: 1, 2 and 4
1, 3 and 5
2, 3 and 4

4. fuel temperature.

1. fuel density
2. fuel quantity in each tank

4. fuel temperature

In an EFIS equipped aircraft, V~1~ speed reference is the...

options.text: take-off decision speed, which is displayed on the primary flight display.
take-off decision speed, which is displayed on the navigation display.
take-off safety speed, which is displayed on the primary flight display.
rotation speed, which is displayed on the primary flight display.

options.text: Magenta
Green
Cyan

variant.question: What are the main components of an Electronic Flight Instrument System (EFIS)?

options.text: Symbol generator, display screens, command panel.
Flight Management Computer, symbol generator, display screens.

Display screens only.

variant.question: The rotary mode-selector knob of the EFIS ND allows the crew to select...

options.text: a display that is oriented as either “heading up” or “track up”.
a side-view, a top-view, or a three-dimensional view.
a colour palette from a menu.
an aircraft symbol in the centre or in the lower part of the screen.

The EFIS control panel allows the pilots to change which of the following?

options.text: 1,2 and 4
1,3 and 5
1,2 and 3
2,4 and 5

The remote light sensor of an EFIS is a

options.text: photodiode that measures ambient light conditions.
solar cell that supplies power during a total electrical failure.
small camera that measures the light intensity of the display units.
potentiometer that measures the position of the brightness switch.

1. The ND displays flight director command bars
2. The PFD displays the altimeter setting
3. The ND displays the attitude of the aircraft
4. The flight mode annunciator is part of the ND

On the EFIS NAV display, weather radar can be displayed in which modes?

options.text: Weather radar can be displayed on some expanded modes
Weather radar can be displayed on all modes
Weather radar can be displayed on Full Rose modes only
Weather radar is not displayed

variant.question: The EFIS Navigation Display (ND) may show...

options.text: Magnetic Heading, track, and course-related information.
information from ground-, weather-, primary-, and secondary radar.
speed information such as Mach number, IAS, Groundspeed, and Wind Velocity.
present position in latitude and longitude coordinates.

3. Weather Radar

options.text: green
yellow
magenta
white

options.text: white
red
cyan

variant.question: What is V1 and where is it shown on an EFIS aircraft?

options.text: take-off decision speed, displayed on the PFD airspeed tape
take-off decision speed, displayed on the PFD VSI
the safe climb speed, displayed on the PFD VSI
the safe climb speed, displayed on the PFD airspeed tape

variant.question: The commander’s PFD display fails. Which of the following is true about reconfiguration?

options.text: The copilot’s PFD display is automatically duplicated on the screen corresponding to the commander’s ND.
Reconfiguration is not possible since the screen is not working.
The copilot’s PFD display is automatically duplicated on the screen corresponding to the copilot’s ND.
Reconfiguration is not required since the copilot’s PFD is still working.

variant.question: In an EFIS with two symbol generators, if one fails the serviceable symbol generator:

options.text: Can be switched manually to supply both displays, but both will be the same
Can be switched manually to supply either display, but not both
Will switch automatically to supply both the Captain’s and FO’s displays
Will switch automatically to supply each display according to its own selection on the control panel

variant.question: According to CS-25, in case of an EFIS failure, standby instruments must normally be...

options.text: available without additional flight crew action.
available upon activation by the Commander or Co-pilot.
switched on manually by the flight crew.
switched on manually. or in case of a combination of failures, switched on automatically

variant.question: According to CS-25, in case of an EFIS failure, standby instruments must normally be...

options.text: available without additional flight crew action.
switched on manually by the flight crew.
switched on manually, or in the case of combination of failures, switched on automatically.
available upon activation by the Commander of Co-pilot.

variant.question: Under the EASA regulations color code rules for EFIS displays, the features displayed in GREEN indicate:

options.text: engaged modes.
cautions, abnormal sources.
the ILS deviation pointer.
the earth.

variant.question: Which component of typical EFIS generates the visual displays on the EADI and EHSI?

options.text: Symbol Generator.
Flight Management Computer.
Flight Control Computer.
Navigation database.

options.text: Engaged Modes
Go
Caution

variant.question: According to certification specifications colour standardisations, features displayed in red on an EFIS indicate..

options.text: Warnings, flight envelope, system limits.
Flight envelope, system limits, engaged mode.
Warnings, cautions, abnormal sources.
Cautions, abnormal sources, engaged mode.

variant.question: The colour red on an Electronic Flight Instrument System (EFIS) indicates:

options.text: Warnings; flight envelope and system limits
Cautions and abnormal sources; engaged modes
Flight envelope and system limits; engaged modes
Warnings; cautions and abnormal sources

variant.question: On a common EFIS display, how are deviations from the glide slope indicated?

options.text: By a diamond moving on a measuring tape
By a pointer and colour-coded dial
By a white horizontal line moving vertically in the EADI
On a numbered tape right beside the ADI
